messages.content: I am writing about the General Election on December 12th. David Gauke, former Tory Lord Chancellor, has said that a Tory victory and the hard Brexit it would bring would be 'disastrous' - extremely damaging for both farming and manufacturing. However, the Lib Dems only got 3% of the vote here last time - they cannot win. The only way to stop the Tories in this very marginal constituency, and to prevent this 'disastrous' Brexit, is to vote for me.

messages.title: Trust is an issue in this election.
messages.content: Senior Tories say the Prime Minister leads a 'crazy' government. In this situation an experienced and independent-minded MP is important to hold counsels and work cross-party. As a former Tory Minister Sir Oliver Letwin has said, 'Helen Goodman busted a gut to get a sensible Brexit.'

messages.title: On climate change, Labour has a much stronger offer than the Tories
messages.content: The Tories have dithered and delayed – and made 'incredibly slow progress' on the economy, on Brexit group.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will achieve net zero emissions in the 2030s and will launch a £250 billion Green Industrial Revolution, creating millions of jobs in every region to the ones business group.

Labour will set up a North East Regional Development Bank, from the North East, to support the private sector and invest in good jobs. This will include a new local network to make loans to small businesses.

Labour will provide free, high quality nursery places for all 2-4 year olds, and extend paid maternity leave to 12 months. It will reduce class sizes in primary schools, abolish student loans and invest in further and adult education.
When I was first elected there were no food banks in this constituency. Now after nine years of Tory government there are seven.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Lib Dems only got 3% of the vote here last time - they cannot win. The only way to stop the Tories in this very marginal constituency is to vote for me.
